meanings.definition: A person who operates a telegraph machine.
meanings.sent1: The telegrapher typed out messages on the telegraph machine.
meanings.sent2: The telegrapher received a message and quickly decoded it.
meanings.sent3: The telegrapher accidentally sent a message to the wrong recipient!
meanings.sent4: She was a telegrapher of emotions, transmitting joy and sorrow with her words.
meanings.sent5: The telegrapher's fingers danced across the keys, sending messages across the wires.

meanings.definition: A person who sends or receives telegraph messages.
meanings.sent1: The telegrapher at the station sent an urgent message to the next town.
meanings.sent2: The telegrapher received a distress call and immediately alerted the authorities.
meanings.sent3: The telegrapher's cat tried to mimic sending messages on the telegraph machine!
meanings.sent4: He was a telegrapher of hope, spreading positive news far and wide.
meanings.sent5: The telegrapher's dedication to his work made him a master of communication through wires.
